metadata.title: CVE-2018-10929 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs2_create_req in glusterfs server. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to create arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code on glusterfs server nodes. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled RPC requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to write iles to an arbitrary location and execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-10929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterd0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
